main event: A rancher discovered three pieces of an aluminum ballast ring near Delta, Colorado, initially found in 1946, reported on April 4, 1949.
interesting points: The objects were identified as parts of a Japanese incendiary balloon used during World War II., The aluminum ring had 72 holes in the periphery for explosive plugs., The rancher picked up the articles about six weeks before reporting them to the OSI., Investigations confirmed the identification with prior publications., The report indicates that there was significant interest from military intelligence in the findings.
sighted object: three broken pieces of an aluminum ballast ring
witness description: a rancher located six miles South Southwest of Delta, Colorado
